solution_line_template: A sandwich and a pack of juice cost ${sandwich_cost} + ${juice_cost} = $<<{sandwich_cost}+{juice_cost}={total_cost_per_set}>>{total_cost_per_set}.
With Lyle's ${lyle_money}, he can buy ${lyle_money}/${total_cost_per_set} = <<{lyle_money}/{total_cost_per_set}={num_sets_lyle_can_buy}>>{num_sets_lyle_can_buy} sets of sandwiches and juice.

Therefore, {num_sets_lyle_can_buy} - {lyle_own_set} = <<{num_sets_lyle_can_buy}-{lyle_own_set}={num_friends}>>{num_friends} of his friends can have a sandwich and a pack of juice since the other {lyle_own_set} set is for Lyle himself.
